RESPONDER DISCOVERED LEAKAGE CAME FROM CAP.

item.title: Report E-2023090559
item.description:
Report E-2023090559

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN1903 were damaged by a load shift and released approximately a quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon to remediate the site. Ancon personnel deployed granular absorbents to the disinfectant-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and impacted wood were collected and containerized into one (1)30-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report X-2023081955
item.description:
Report X-2023081955

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081955 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD RLTO TRAILER 560882 WET ON TOP AND LEAKING. DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. PACKAGE PACKED INTO TRAILER UPSIDE DOWN. DescribePack: THREE BOTTLES WITH SUCKED IN BODIES. CAPS, THOUGH TIGHT, SLOWLY LEAKED. HALF GALLON LOSS OF MATERIAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM. 2. X-2023081958 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD RLTO TRAILER 560882 WET. DAMAGED IN TRANSIT INITIALLY FROM ANOTHER DAMAGED HAZMAT PACKAGE BUT ALSO HAS INTERNAL LEAKAGE FROM LOOSE CAP. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM CAP AN EIGHTH OF A TURN LOOSE. ONE TENTH OF A GALLON LOSS. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.description:

  • State: CA

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM HRBG UNLOAD TRAILER 567757 WET AND CRUSHED OPEN. INADEQUATE BLOCK AND BRACE AND TOO MUCH WEIGHT. DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. DescribePack: ALL BOTTLES LEAKED FROM CAPS NOT HOLDING SEAL, OF WHICH ALL ARE DENTED AND CRUSHED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report I-2023090101
item.description:
Report I-2023090101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: Santa Clara
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Around 6:30am, the yard personnel were in the process of transferring containers to different trailers when they noticed a tote that might have a possible leak around the valve. They prepped an empty tote in the event there was a need to transfer the material out of the tote. Once they were all prepped, they checked the valve handle to make sure it was fully in the closed position. When the outlet cap was unscrewed, the material shot out of the valve due to a missing ball valve. Over half of the material was captured in the second tote and approximately 125 gals of the material released to the asphalt around the load dock. There was no release to the environment. The yard team quickly controlled the release with berms, absorbents, and vermiculite/floor dry and proceeded to clean up the material.

RESPONDER DECONTAMINATED ANY EQUIPMENT.

It was immediately placed in a plastic lined container and submitted for inspection. DescribePack: Cap was loose about a quarter of a turn. This was enough for the liquid to leak out of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: With the quick respond from the package handler, it prevented a spill and only the box that got damaged.

item.title: Report X-2023081867

  • Description: SequenceEvent: AFTER PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER AND THE SPILLAGE WAS NOTED BY THE DOCK ADMIN ON THE VAN LINE. THE DRUM WAS IMMEDIATELY PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG, PUT INTO A HAZARDOUS TOTE AND PLACED ONTO A SPILL PALLET FOR FURTHER EVALUATION. DescribePack: THE CAP ON THE PLASTIC DRUM WAS LOOSE CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK ONTO THE OVERPACK BOX (BOTTOM OF BOX WAS CORRORDED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DRUM WAS IMMEDIATELY PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG, PUT INTO A HAZARDOUS TOTE AND PLACED ONTO A SPILL PALLET FOR FURTHER EVALUATION.

item.title: Report X-2023081865
item.description:
Report X-2023081865

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: ANAHEIM

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081865 SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the corner of the outer container while been unloaded. package was place in to a hazmat bag and tote and take for inspection. upon inspection we found one of the four bottles had a loose cap causing it to leak approx 10oz all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: The package was leaking from the bottle top due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote with all clean up material. 2. X-2023081897 SequenceEvent: The package was found to had fallen of the roller on the unload area causing to leak. Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote and take for inspection. Upon inspection we found one of the four bottle had a loose cap causing to leak approx 10 oz of product. All clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a loose cap causing to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081854
item.description:
Report X-2023081854

DescribePack: there was a 1 mm crack at the bottom part of the body which the liquid was able to spill out of. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately placed in a plastic lined container, wiped any spill with an absorbent pad.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD 25. SAND WAS USED TO CLEAN IT UP BEFORE QA WAS NOTIFIED. A CHEM REACTION BEGAN AND WAS GIVING OFF HEAT. SPILL WAS BIG AND GIVING OFF A INTOXICATING ODOR. ONE OF THE CONTETNS HAS A 1IN CRACK ON ITS SEEM. SPILL WAS DANGOURS TO CLEAN DUE TO THE SAND. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTETNS HAS A 1IN CRACK ON ITS SEEM. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: SAND WAS UNSED TO CLEAN IT UP BEFORE QA WAS NOTIFIED. A CHEM REACTION BEGAN AND WAS GIVING OFF HEAT. SPILL WAS BIG AND GIVING OFF A INTOXICATING ODOR. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG ALONG WITH CLEAN UP MATERIALS WAS PUT UNDER FUME HOOD UNTIL IT STOP GIVING OFF HEAT.

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package submitted wet on 1 side with blue staining on the outer box. Inside is a white box with a diamond LQ label on it. Inside that was 4 qty of 1 Gallon plastic container of Pond Champs Algae X, with 1 dented, cap loose, and leaked internally. DescribePack: Package was dented in the middle of its body. Cap was loose by 1 full turn. Seal was open by a quarter of an inch. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic lined container. No spill was seen around the package to be wiped.

item.title: Report X-2023081540

Report X-2023081540

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was submitted for inspection because it got wet from another package. Inside, found a ripped bag of 50 lbs. Copper Sulfate Pentahydrate with its content spilled inside the outer box. DescribePack: A 7 in rip was found on the top part of the bag just near the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill happened inside of the outer packaging. Then a spill happened during inspection which was immediately swept up and put back in the outer packaging.

Report X-2023081533

  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on the end of the NC rollers and rolled off onto the floor. When discovered PH Neutralizer was put on all of the spilled liquid and the pail was put into a lined damaged hazardous materials tote to stop any further leakage. DescribePack: The lid was not on tightly causing the liquid to spill when the package fell. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined damaged hazardous materials tote.
